1.q_string: Which of the following statement can define the Lenz law?
q_option: The induced current flows in such a way that its direction is always anticlockwise.
The induced current flows in such a way that its direction helps the change that induces it.
The induced current flows in such a way that its direction opposes the change that induces it.
The Lenz law does not tells about induced current direction.

1.q_string: Lenz law is consequence of the law of conservation of:
Two similar circular loops carry equal currents in the same direction. On moving the coils further apart, the electric current will:
q_option: Increases in one and decreases in the second

1.q_string: Lenzs law is bifurcated form of law:
The direction of induced emf can be found by:
When a bar magnet is moved towards a metallic coil as shown in the figure. When it is seen from the top, the direction of the induced current will be:
Choose the incorrect statement regarding Lenz law.
q_option: It gives the direction of induced emf.
It is based on the law of conservation of energy.
It is based on the law of conservation of momentum.

1.q_string: If the north pole of a magnet is moved away from a coil which is connected in a closed circuit, then the direction of current in the coil on the magnet side will be:
q_option: No current will flow in the coil

1.q_string: If we increase the current in an inductor, self inductance of the inductor will ____________.
What is the combined inductance of two series-connected inductors?
q_option: Inductors can not be connected in series

1.q_string: The self-inductance of a solenoid of length \(L\), area of cross-section \(A\) and having \(N\) turns is:
The maximum possible mutual inductance between two coils of inductance \(L _1\) and \(L _2\) can be:
An air core solenoid has 1000 turns and is one metre long. Its cross-sectional area is 10 square \(cm\). Its self-inductance is:
A coil of wire of radius \(R\) has 200 turns and self - inductance of \(108 mH\). The self inductance of a similar coil of 500 turns will be:
The property of a coil by which a counter emf is induced in it, when the current through the coil changes, is called:
In a coil of \(N\) turns, a current of i produces a magnetic flux of \(\phi\). Find the self inductance of this coil.
A device that is a coil of wire around a central core and can store energy in a magnetic field when current flows through it. This device is:

The current in an inductor of inductance \(100 mH\) is dropped from \(4 A\) to \(0 A\).

The time required to induce \(5 V\) across the inductor is:

Two long solenoids \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) have equal lengths and the solenoid \(S_1\) is placed coaxially inside the solenoid \(S_2\). If the current in both the solenoids is doubled, then the mutual inductance of both the solenoids will become:
Two long solenoids \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) have equal lengths and the solenoid \(S_1\) is placed coaxially inside the solenoid \(S_2\). The mutual inductance of both the solenoids is proportional to the:
q_option: Square of the radius of the inner solenoid
Square of the radius of the outer solenoid

1.q_string: Two coils of self inductance \(4 mH\) and \(9 mH\) are placed closed to each other such that the flux in one coil is completely linked with the other, then the mutual inductance between these coils is:

Two solenoids \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) have equal lengths of \(2 m\) and the solenoid \(S_1\) is placed coaxially inside the solenoid \(S_2\). The number of turns per unit length of both the solenoids is 100 . The radius of the solenoid \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) is \(7 cm\) and \(14 cm\) respectively, then find the mutual inductance.

Two long solenoids \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) have equal lengths and the solenoid \(S_1\) is placed coaxially inside the solenoid \(S_2\). This pair of solenoids have a mutual inductance of 200 \(H\). The number of turns in solenoid \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) are 100 and 120 respectively. If the current in the outer solenoid is \(5 A\), then the flux linkage with the inner solenoid is:

Two long solenoids \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) have equal lengths and the solenoid \(S_1\) is placed coaxially inside the solenoid \(S_2\). The ratio of the radius of the solenoid \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) is \(1: 2\). If the mutual inductance of the solenoid \(S_1\) due to solenoid \(S_2\) is \(4 H\), then the mutual inductance of the solenoid \(S_2\) due to solenoid \(S_1\) will be:

Two long solenoids \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) have equal lengths and the solenoid \(S_1\) is placed coaxially inside the solenoid \(S_2\). If the radius of the inner solenoid is halved, then the mutual inductance of both the solenoids will become:

Two long solenoids \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) of equal length are placed co-axially as shown in the figure. The radius of the solenoid \(S_1\) is less than solenoid \(S_2\). If the radius of solenoid \(S_2\) is doubled then the mutual inductance of solenoid \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) will:
q_option: increase for solenoid \(S_1\) and decrease for solenoid \(S_2\)
decrease for solenoid \(S_1\) decrease and increase for solenoid \(S_2\)

1.q_string: Two long solenoids \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) of equal length 'I' are placed co-axially as shown in the figure. The radius of the solenoid \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) are \(r_1\) and \(r_2\) respectively, and the number of turns per unit length of the solenoid \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) is \(n_1\) and \(n_2\) respectively. If the \(r_1\) is less than \(r_2\), then the mutual inductance of both the solenoids depend on the:

Two long solenoids \(S_1\) and \(S_2\) of equal length are placed co-axially as shown in the figure. The radius and number of turns per unit length of the solenoid \(S_1\) are less than solenoid \(S_2\), then the mutual inductance of solenoid \(S_1\) will be:
Identify the factor on which self-inductance does not depend.
Identify the factor on which mutual inductance does not depend.
q_option: The relative orientation of the two coils
